nodeMetric.field_description: Followers is the number of users who have chosen to follow another user’s or company’s posts, such as via Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook or Instagram. It is a key measure of popularity and can point to how well you are building a community around your brand.

body.processed: Followers is a purely quantitative metric, and as such it's important to look at engagement metrics such as Likes, Comments, and Shares as well.
body.summary: Followers is the number of users who have chosen to follow another user's or company's posts, such as via Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook or Instagram. First and foremost, it is a measure of popularity.

field_related_metrics.field_description: Page Reach is a count of the number of people who viewed your pages or posts at least once.

For content and social media marketers, Content Engagement, may be one of the most important ways to know what is working and how to improve your craft. Content Engagement measures all engagements resulting from content generated in a social media account. These may include shares, likes, comments, re-tweets, etc.
Page Likes, which is mostly applicable to social platforms, counts the number of unique visitors who have liked your page.
